# Campaign Context Cache

**Purpose:** Stable marketing campaign knowledge for prompt caching
**Token Budget:** ~2-3k tokens
**Cache Duration:** Long-term (updates quarterly)

---

## Campaign Strategy Frameworks

### SMART Goals Template
- **Specific:** Clear, well-defined objectives
- **Measurable:** Quantifiable metrics (leads, conversions, revenue)
- **Achievable:** Realistic given resources and timeline
- **Relevant:** Aligned with business objectives
- **Time-bound:** Specific deadlines and milestones

### Campaign Types

**Awareness Campaigns:**
- Goal: Brand visibility, reach, impressions
- Channels: Social media, display ads, PR, content marketing
- Metrics: Reach, impressions, brand lift, share of voice
- Timeline: 3-6 months typically

**Consideration Campaigns:**
- Goal: Engagement, education, nurturing
- Channels: Email, webinars, content, retargeting
- Metrics: Engagement rate, time on site, content downloads
- Timeline: 1-3 months

**Conversion Campaigns:**
- Goal: Direct response, sales, sign-ups
- Channels: Search ads, retargeting, email, landing pages
- Metrics: Conversion rate, CPA, ROI, revenue
- Timeline: 2-8 weeks

**Retention Campaigns:**
- Goal: Customer loyalty, repeat purchases, advocacy
- Channels: Email, in-app, loyalty programs, community
- Metrics: Retention rate, LTV, NPS, referral rate
- Timeline: Ongoing

---

## Multi-Channel Campaign Structure

### Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1-2)
- Define objectives and KPIs
- Audience segmentation and persona mapping
- Competitive analysis
- Budget allocation across channels
- Creative brief and messaging framework
- Landing page and conversion path design

### Phase 2: Launch (Week 3-4)
- Organic social media posts (3-5x per week)
- Paid social ads (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter)
- Search ads (Google, Bing)
- Email campaign (3-email sequence)
- PR outreach and partnerships
- Influencer collaboration

### Phase 3: Optimization (Week 5-8)
- A/B testing (ads, emails, landing pages)
- Budget reallocation based on performance
- Creative refresh for underperforming assets
- Audience refinement
- Conversion rate optimization
- Retargeting campaigns for engaged users

### Phase 4: Scale (Week 9-12)
- Expand winning channels and tactics
- Geographic or demographic expansion
- Lookalike audience targeting
- Increased budget to top performers
- Additional content assets
- Partnership and collaboration scaling

---

## Channel Mix Best Practices

### B2B Campaigns
- **LinkedIn Ads:** 30-40% of paid budget
- **Google Search:** 25-35%
- **Email Marketing:** Core channel (owned)
- **Content Marketing:** Blog, whitepapers, webinars
- **Account-Based Marketing:** For enterprise targets

### B2C Campaigns
- **Facebook/Instagram:** 35-45% of paid budget
- **Google Search/Shopping:** 25-35%
- **TikTok/YouTube:** 15-25% (younger demographics)
- **Email Marketing:** Automation and segmentation
- **Influencer Marketing:** 10-20% of budget

### SaaS Campaigns
- **Product-Led Growth:** Free trial, freemium
- **Content Marketing:** SEO, educational content
- **Google Search:** High-intent keywords
- **LinkedIn:** Decision-maker targeting
- **Retargeting:** Multi-touch attribution
- **Email Nurturing:** 7-10 touch points

---

## Budget Allocation Guidelines

### 70-20-10 Rule
- **70%:** Proven channels with positive ROI
- **20%:** Optimization and testing
- **10%:** Experimental channels and new tactics

### Testing Budget
- Minimum $1,000 per channel for statistically significant data
- 2-4 weeks testing period
- Clear success criteria before scaling

### Channel ROI Benchmarks
- **Google Search:** 200-400% ROI (high-intent)
- **Facebook/Instagram:** 150-300% ROI
- **LinkedIn B2B:** 175-350% ROI
- **Email Marketing:** 3600% ROI average (lowest cost)
- **Content Marketing:** 300% ROI (long-term)

---

## Campaign Messaging Framework

### Value Proposition Canvas
**Customer Jobs:**
- Functional jobs (tasks to accomplish)
- Social jobs (how they want to be perceived)
- Emotional jobs (feelings they seek)

**Pain Points:**
- Obstacles preventing job completion
- Risks and consequences
- Current solution inadequacies

**Gain Creators:**
- Expected gains (must-have)
- Desired gains (want-to-have)
- Unexpected gains (wow-factor)

### Message Hierarchy
1. **Primary Message:** Core value proposition (1 sentence)
2. **Supporting Messages:** Key benefits (3-5 bullet points)
3. **Proof Points:** Social proof, data, testimonials
4. **Call-to-Action:** Specific next step

---

## Campaign Templates

### Product Launch Campaign (8-week)
**Pre-Launch (Week 1-3):**
- Teaser content and countdown
- Email list building
- Influencer seeding
- PR pitching

**Launch (Week 4-5):**
- Announcement email blast
- Social media blitz
- Press release distribution
- Launch event or webinar
- Paid ads activation

**Post-Launch (Week 6-8):**
- User-generated content
- Customer testimonials
- Case studies
- Optimization and scaling

### Seasonal Campaign (4-6 week)
- Research trends and opportunities (2 weeks before)
- Creative production (2-3 weeks before)
- Pre-campaign teasing (1 week before)
- Peak season execution (1-2 weeks)
- Post-season wrap-up offers (1 week after)

### Event Promotion Campaign (6-week)
- Save-the-date announcement (Week 1)
- Early bird registration (Week 2-3)
- Speaker/agenda promotion (Week 3-4)
- Last chance messaging (Week 5-6)
- Day-of engagement (Event day)
- Post-event follow-up (Week after)

---

## KPI Dashboards

### Awareness Metrics
- Impressions: Total ad views
- Reach: Unique users exposed
- Brand lift: Awareness increase %
- Share of voice: % of category conversation

### Engagement Metrics
- Click-through rate (CTR): 2-5% benchmark
- Engagement rate: Likes, comments, shares / reach
- Time on site: 2-3 minutes average
- Pages per session: 2-3 pages benchmark
- Video completion rate: 50-70% for short-form

### Conversion Metrics
- Conversion rate: 2-5% landing page benchmark
- Cost per acquisition (CPA): Industry-specific
- Return on ad spend (ROAS): 3:1 minimum, 5:1 target
- Lead quality score: MQL/SQL conversion rate

### Retention Metrics
- Customer lifetime value (LTV): Revenue over lifetime
- Retention rate: % of customers retained month-over-month
- Net promoter score (NPS): -100 to +100 scale
- Repeat purchase rate: % making 2+ purchases

---

## Quick Campaign Checklist

**Before Launch:**
- [ ] Clear objectives and success metrics defined
- [ ] Target audience and personas documented
- [ ] Budget allocated across channels
- [ ] Creative assets produced and approved
- [ ] Landing pages built and tested
- [ ] Tracking and analytics configured
- [ ] A/B test plan documented
- [ ] Approval workflows completed

**During Campaign:**
- [ ] Daily performance monitoring
- [ ] Weekly optimization reviews
- [ ] Budget pacing on track
- [ ] Creative refresh as needed
- [ ] Audience refinement ongoing
- [ ] Stakeholder reporting (weekly)

**After Campaign:**
- [ ] Full performance analysis
- [ ] ROI calculation and reporting
- [ ] Lessons learned documentation
- [ ] Winning assets cataloged
- [ ] Audience insights captured
- [ ] Next campaign recommendations
